channel.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
channel.description:
Most of you guys are usually interested in what Jagex watches/cares about, and don't generally visit moparisthebest.com, so I figured I'd post a link here:
https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,433169.msg3719506.html#msg3719506
Interesting, right? :)

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

What responses? I didn’t respond to them at all. I also recommended people don’t suggest they will commit suicide for appeal requests, but I’m not going to censor everyone’s speech on the forums to appease a company.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

No offense mitb (ok, some offense) but your responses come across as a really immature and ignorant, not to mention incorrect (it was a request for a serious issue, not a dmca takedown).

Disappointing, but not surprising.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“bootnecklad, post:47, topic:411546”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=512804.msg3723544#msg3723544 date=1314120051]
The police also found that guy I reported for posting a youtube video with him and his friends busting up cars on here, all I could give the cops were names and IPs, maybe they got more from youtube itself?
[/quote]

I remember that idiot! He posted a video where him and his mates smashing cars with skateboards and a vending machine. Everyone was like “…” and you reported them! Did you hear anything of it?[/quote]
The police never called me or anything, but my brother saw a segment on ‘E News’ on TV where the kid from this forum apologized (his friends didn’t), I also found a news paper article regarding it I think. Anyone care to try to look it up again? I think he lived in Scottsdale, AZ.

edit:
Bahahaha, found it:

liveleak.com

Liveleak.com - Kids caught after posting video of themselves vandalising cars on...

SCOTTSDALE - Four Scottsdale youths who posted a video "of us bre..


I was the ‘tip’.

edit:
Found him, his name is ‘Carson’ (same name in real life, they posted them on the youtube video too, morons…)

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

edit3:
looks like jme found a link to this long ago:
http://www.azcentral.com/community/scottsdale/articles/0321sr-vandals0322ON.html

That’s right, it wasn’t ‘E News’, it was ‘Inside Edition’:

Inside Edition

Investigations, Inspiration, and Offbeat Stories & Videos from TV's...

Find the latest uplifting news, investigations, videos and more on InsideEdition.com.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:88, topic:187670”]As to the ‘snitching’, in my eyes this is different from turning someone in for a crime, which is what I did.

Back on topic, my brother actually saw this on TV the other day and called me, then emailed me the articles he found:

Inside Edition

Investigations, Inspiration, and Offbeat Stories & Videos from TV's...

Find the latest uplifting news, investigations, videos and more on InsideEdition.com.


http://www.azcentral.com/community/scottsdale/articles/0321sr-vandals0322ON.html
http://www.ktar.com/?nid=6&sid=770037
http://www.kpho.com/news/15675016/detail.html?rss=pho&psp=news

Carson actually seems to be the best of his friends, as he wrote an apology letter and appeared on TV to apologize. Good job to carson and I hope you have learned your lesson.[/quote]

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:45, topic:411546”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=512804.msg3723489#msg3723489 date=1314117374]

That e-mail is better written than their automated responses, which gives me the idea that they know what we talk about here (they actually watch us), but they are kind enough to not try and shut us down. If they even can, legally, though? It seems like Jagex goes along with their game, and they let the private server community evolve in a (possible) sense of curiosity.

Kind enough not to try and shut us down? Did I forget to mention my host (gigenet) has been getting DMCA takedown notices about every week for the last few months about moparisthebest.com? I always reply to them promptly, and they ignore my email and send another identical one to gigenet. Even the staff at gigenet told them to email me directly at admin@moparisthebest.com, and they ignore that too. Bastards.

@suicide, I think they have a duty to report it too, like someone here already said, if they report 1000 fake suicides a year and 1 that turns out to be a real threat where a life is saved, it would be worth it.
[/quote]I’m assuming that the first few DMCA requests that were forwarded to you by Giganet, you promptly had to explain the situation multiple times? How in the world did you avoid getting shutdown by Giganet? I’m assuming any typical company who receives a DMCA will instantly shut down an account without even contacting their customer…[/quote]
Unfortunately that does happen, but Gigenet is a good company who understands the DMCA and their obligations under it. Basically the forward the request to me, and if I either fix the issues they complain about, or dispute the issues they complain amount in a reasonable amount of time, Gigenet (the host) is wholly not responsible for any of the content, whether it is illegal, copyrighted, or not.

Read full topic
item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

If they even can, legally, though? It seems like Jagex goes along with their game, and they let the private server community evolve in a (possible) sense of curiosity.
[/quote]

Kind enough not to try and shut us down? Did I forget to mention my host (gigenet) has been getting DMCA takedown notices about every week for the last few months about moparisthebest.com? I always reply to them promptly, and they ignore my email and send another identical one to gigenet. Even the staff at gigenet told them to email me directly at admin@moparisthebest.com, and they ignore that too. Bastards.

@suicide, I think they have a duty to report it too, like someone here already said, if they report 1000 fake suicides a year and 1 that turns out to be a real threat where a life is saved, it would be worth it.[/quote]I’m assuming that the first few DMCA requests that were forwarded to you by Giganet, you promptly had to explain the situation multiple times? How in the world did you avoid getting shutdown by Giganet? I’m assuming any typical company who receives a DMCA will instantly shut down an account without even contacting their customer…

item.source: Jagex is always watching, and demanding

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

The police also found that guy I reported for posting a youtube video with him and his friends busting up cars on here, all I could give the cops were names and IPs, maybe they got more from youtube itself?

I’m not sure why people are so convinced that they can’t get the ISP to give an address from an IP.

Cellphones have a system that allows tapping, with multiple taps maintained at once, from a simple interface, because it’s so regular a request that they need the infrastructure in place. The same kind of thing is being implemented (at least in the UK, I assume elsewhere) for internet traffic. With that in mind, it really isn’t far fetched that they could get a warrant to force an address out of an ISP within like, what a few hours?

EDIT: afaict they dont need a warrant, ripa has

(g)for the purpose, in an emergency, of preventing death or injury or any damage to a person’s physical or mental health, or of mitigating any injury or damage to a person’s physical or mental health; or

As a legitimate reason to access the data

Read full topic

item.title: Jagex is always watching, and demanding
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

zachera:

That e-mail is better written than their automated responses, which gives me the idea that they know what we talk about here (they actually watch us), but they are kind enough to not try and shut us down. If they even can, legally, though? It seems like Jagex goes along with their game, and they let the private server community evolve in a (possible) sense of curiosity.

Kind enough not to try and shut us down? Did I forget to mention my host (gigenet) has been getting DMCA takedown notices about every week for the last few months about moparisthebest.com? I always reply to them promptly, and they ignore my email and send another identical one to gigenet. Even the staff at gigenet told them to email me directly at admin@moparisthebest.com, and they ignore that too. Bastards.

@suicide, I think they have a duty to report it too, like someone here already said, if they report 1000 fake suicides a year and 1 that turns out to be a real threat where a life is saved, it would be worth it.

Read full topic
